revised_title: Report on the Total Solar Eclipse of 1911, April 28: Observations from Vavau, Tonga Islands
tldr: The authors report on the observations and findings from the total solar eclipse of 1911, April 28, focusing on the corona, spectroscopy, and the use of coronagraphs. The expedition, organized by the Joint Permanent Eclipse Committee, observed the eclipse from Vavau, Tonga Islands, capturing images of the corona and spectrum of the sun.
